channel.title: jquery on Roy Tang
channel.description: Recent content in jquery on Roy Tang

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
I’m trying to trace a slowdown on load of a web page in our application and there’s a ton of JavaScript to go through so I’d rather not process them individually.

I’m trying to see if there’s a way to list out all the event handlers added to $(document).ready() so that I would just look through those handlers to see what might be causing the problem.

Is there a way to do this?

item.title: Reply to 'Loop through string of dropdown options and select' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11465807/loop-through-string-of-dropdown-options-and-select:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'Loop through string of dropdown options and select' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11465807/loop-through-string-of-dropdown-options-and-select:

Is this in an HTML page? If yes, why not just use something like $(“option”).each()?

item.title: Reply to 'How to generate an random 8 character string that won't occur twice in jQuery?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8470859/how-to-generate-an-random-8-character-string-that-wont-occur-twice-in-jquery:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'How to generate an random 8 character string that won't occur twice in jQuery?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8470859/how-to-generate-an-random-8-character-string-that-wont-occur-twice-in-jquery:

Why not just use the current time (as an integer)?

item.title: Reply to 'How many times can I have jQuery's document ready function declared on a page?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4471349/how-many-times-can-i-have-jquerys-document-ready-function-declared-on-a-page:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'How many times can I have jQuery's document ready function declared on a page?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4471349/how-many-times-can-i-have-jquerys-document-ready-function-declared-on-a-page:

As many times as you like. They fire in order of declaration.

$(document).ready() will fire when the document is ready (when it’s all loaded by the browser). The other one will fire as soon as that part of the script executes.

item.title: Reply to 'how to use jquery UI autocomplete 1.8.4?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3695414/how-to-use-jquery-ui-autocomplete-1-8-4:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'how to use jquery UI autocomplete 1.8.4?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3695414/how-to-use-jquery-ui-autocomplete-1-8-4:

If you want to use jquery ui autocomplete, your data must be “a simple Array of Strings, or it contains Objects for each item in the array, with either a label or value property or both”. This is from the documentation at http://jqueryui.com/demos/autocomplete/

Your server response does not follow the expected data type, you should modify suggest.php to post-process the data into label-value pairs.

As I understand it, you also want to perform a custom action when an item is selected from the autocomplete, so you should also add a handler for the ‘select’ event.

item.title: Reply to 'jQuery - split() arrays with only one match = undefined' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3599620/jquery-split-arrays-with-only-one-match-undefined:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'jQuery - split() arrays with only one match = undefined' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3599620/jquery-split-arrays-with-only-one-match-undefined:

You already have the lines logging your values array, was it so hard to add lines logging the other vars?

c1_arr = c1.split(';');

The array created here is [‘font-color:#ff0000’, ‘'] - there is a blank second element since there’s nothing after the ‘;’ in the input string.

Then when you call:

values[1][i]= c1_arr[i].split(':');

c1_arr[1] is empty string, so values[1][1] is an array with only one element, empty string.

values[1][1][0] -> empty string values[1][1][1] -> undefined (no second element)

item.title: Reply to 'How do I set a radio button value using jQuery?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3243206/how-do-i-set-a-radio-button-value-using-jquery:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'How do I set a radio button value using jQuery?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3243206/how-do-i-set-a-radio-button-value-using-jquery:

You can give each radio element an id then $("#id”).attr(“value”, “thevalueyouwant”) for each one.

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Is there any Python library that allows me to parse an HTML document similar to what jQuery does?

i.e. I’d like to be able to use CSS selector syntax to grab an arbitrary set of nodes from the document, read their content/attributes, etc.

The only Python HTML parsing lib I’ve used before was BeautifulSoup, and even though it’s fine I keep thinking it would be faster to do my parsing if I had jQuery syntax available. :D

item.title: Reply to 'How to stop "setInterval"' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1831152/how-to-stop-setinterval:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'How to stop "setInterval"' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1831152/how-to-stop-setinterval:

setInterval returns an id that you can use to cancel the interval with clearInterval()

item.title: Reply to 'jQuery, how to call a function while passing a variable' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1831116/jquery-how-to-call-a-function-while-passing-a-variable:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'jQuery, how to call a function while passing a variable' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1831116/jquery-how-to-call-a-function-while-passing-a-variable:

Try wrapping it in a new function object:

$.get("InfoRetrieve", { },function() { addContent(data) });
